verses.roman:
rādhā-bhāva aṅgīkari' dhari' tāra varṇa
tina-sukha āsvādite haba avatīrṇa

synonyms: rādhā-bhāva—the moods of Rādhārāṇī; aṅgīkari'-accepting; dhari'-taking; tāra varṇa—Her bodily complexion; tina—three; sukha—happiness; āsvādite—to taste; haba—I shall; avatīrṇa—descend as an incarnation.
translation: "Therefore, assuming Rādhārāṇī's sentiments and bodily complexion, I shall descend to fulfill these three desires."
